title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Monday, 21 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: sponsored walk raises £ 2,000 for attacked football fan simon dobbin .
union condemns break changes for ambulance staff .
a £ 200m ship may not be called boaty mcboatface after all .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's it for our live updates for today , but we 'll be back with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire at 08:00 tomorrow .

documents.title: weather : staying dry tonight with variable amounts of cloud
text: it will stay dry tonight with some clear spells .
it 'll feel chilly , despite the light winds , and away from large towns like ely patches of frost or fog may form .
minimum temperature : 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be another dry day with light winds and some bright spells .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
head to bbc weather for a more as we head towards the easter weekend .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: shakespeare on tour : telling the story of the bard in cambridgeshire
text: the bbc 's shakespeare on tour project is looking at the places around england with connections to the bard - including cambridgeshire .
early in william shakespeare 's career as a dramatist and actor , the lord chamberlain 's men played in cambridge .
it is possible that shakespeare was with the company , as was popular actor richard burbage , who was acclaimed for his performances in roles such as richard iii .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: attacked cambridge united fan simon dobbin returns to local pub to see sponsored walk
text: simon dobbin returned to his local pub on sunday for the first time since an attack left him with brain damage , to see friends and family start a sponsored walk .
the cambridge united fan was assaulted following a match in southend , essex , a year ago .
the 12-mile sponsored walk raised £ 2,000 to pay for care and equipment at his home in mildenhall , suffolk .
author: Jeremy Sallis
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: details of syd barrett artwork revealed
text: more details about the artwork commissioned to commemorate pink floyd star syd barrett have been revealed .
it will use reflective surfaces and bicycle components to represent his iconic song `` bike '' and his home city of cambridge .
it is a collaboration between suffolk-based artists clare palmier and spadge hopkins and will be placed in the cambridge corn exchange .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : union condemns proposed changes to paramedic meal breaks experts could overrule 'boaty mcboatface ' polar ship name
text: here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: experts could overrule 'boaty mcboatface ' name choice for polar ship
text: the name of a new polar research vessel will be chosen by a panel of experts , even if the public overwhelmingly votes to call it boaty mcboatface .
the £ 200m polar research vessel will be operated by cambridge-based british antarctic survey , which launched an internet poll to help find a name for the ship .
lord west , ex-first sea lord , said he was rather proud `` silly names '' had been suggested , but hoped none were chosen .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: sponsored walk raises £ 2,000 for attacked football fan simon dobbin
text: friends and family of football fan simon dobbin , who was left with brain damage after an attack , have raised £ 2,000 with a 12-mile sponsored walk .
the cambridge united supporter was attacked following a match in southend , essex , a year ago today .
he returned to his home in mildenhall , suffolk , last week .
the money raised will be used to pay for equipment to improve his care .
you can see the full report on tonight 's look east , on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Jeremy Sallis
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: union condemns proposed changes to meal breaks for paramedics
text: the union unison has `` condemned '' the east of england ambulance service over proposed changes to meal breaks and end of shift arrangements .
it says the proposals will end the right of staff to have a meal at base , and crews will be expected to answer non-emergency calls at the end of their shifts .
fraer stevenson , unison branch secretary at the trust , said the plans were `` a huge risk for patient safety and staff welfare '' .
in a consultation document the trust says it intends to trial a number of measures to reduce the number of late finishes and `` better support colleagues '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council leader disappointed by decision on academies
text: the leader of peterborough city council has criticised government plans to convert all schools into academies .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: 19-year-old from cambridge dies after being hit by train at shelford station
text: a teenager has died after being struck by a train at great shelford station yesterday .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: work of cambridgeshire 's carers 'mostly unrecognised ' , says charity
text: the work carried out by thousands of carers in cambridgeshire goes `` mostly unrecognised '' , according to a charity set up to support them .
the carers trust cambridgeshire has launched its pride in our carers awards , to honour the estimated 78,000 people who provide care for a loved-one in the county .
find out more about the awards here .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'boaty mcboatface ' instigator 'sorry ' for ship name suggestion
text: a man who suggested naming a new £ 200m polar research ship `` boaty mcboatface '' has apologised .
the suggestion has attracted more than 8,000 votes in an online poll of names for the royal research ship .
former bbc presenter james hand said he found the list of possible names `` really funny '' so decided to `` throw one into the ring '' .
cambridge-based british antarctic survey , which will operate the vessel , says the online poll has been `` a great way '' to engage people .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: weather : staying fine and dry this afternoon
text: the rest of today will be staying fine and dry .
we will see some sunny spells , the best of which will be during the early part of this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live , head to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : motorcyclist killed in great staughton crash new research vessel could be named 'boaty mcboatface '
text: here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this lunchtime :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: motorcyclist killed in crash named
text: a motorcyclist killed in a crash at great staughton in cambridgeshire yesterday has been named by police as ben daniells , from chelveston in northamptonshire .
the 26-year-old , of raunds road , crashed with a van on the b645 at about 13:20 .
the driver of van - an 86-year-old man from perry near grafham water - was unhurt .
anyone who witnessed the crash is asked to contact police .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: ambulance service says current meal break arrangements 'undermining ' ability to respond to patients
text: the ambulance service says it is considering changes to meal breaks and end of shift arrangements for paramedics because they are `` undermining '' the ability to respond to patients .
the eastern daily press reports about 600 ambulance staff have signed an open letter `` condemning the plans '' .

in a draft consultation document released last week , the trust says it needs to take `` meaningful '' steps to reduce the risks to patients , but intends to trial a number of measures to `` better support colleagues '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paper chase : cambridge university maps paper use in medieval england
text: cambridge university is investigating how paper spread in popularity after its arrival in england in about 1300 .
the people of 14th century norwich were among the early adopters of paper , a `` pivotal technology '' that has parallels with the 21st century emergence of the ipad , researchers say .
the cambridge university team hopes to eventually discover how and why paper arrived later in the uk than elsewhere in europe .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: joanne dennehy : widow attacks triple killer 's legal aid
text: the widow of a man murdered by peterborough triple killer joanne dennehy has branded the decision to grant her legal aid `` ludicrous '' .
dennehy , 33 , is serving life sentences for the murders of three men in 2013 .
she has launched a high court fight for improved prison conditions , challenging a decision keep her segregated .
kevin lee 's widow christina said giving her legal aid was an insult to victims .
the ministry of justice said it `` robustly defends compensation claims as far as the evidence allows '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: historic peterborough church evacuated after fire breaks out
text: a historic peterborough city centre church was evacuated last night after a fire broke out in the basement .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: ambulance staff 'sign letter opposing meal-break plans '
text: about 600 staff at the east of england ambulance service have signed an open letter opposing plans to change meal-breaks for paramedics and other responders , the eastern daily press reports .

a consultation document sent out by the trust last week suggests current meal breaks and end of shift agreements are having a `` denigratory '' impact on the service 's ability to respond to patients .

a spokesman for eeast , which serves bedfordshire , cambridgeshire , essex , hertfordshire , norfolk and suffolk , says : `` not unlike all ambulance services across england , eeast recognises the impact that shift overruns have on our staff and we have put in place a number of measures to tackle this . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peterborough united break eight match losing run after 1-2 victory against doncaster
text: ricardo santos scored an injury-time goal to give peterborough their first victory in eight league games , and send doncaster into the relegation places .
defeat extended doncaster 's winless run to 13 games and saw former posh boss darren ferguson 's side slip into the relegation places below blackpool .
head to bbc sport for a full match report .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'boaty mcboatface ' could be name of new polar research vessel
text: a new £ 200m polar research vessel could be be called `` boaty mcboatface '' after cambridge-based british antarctic survey ( bas ) launched an online poll to name it .
the vessel is currently under construction at cammell laird 's yard in birkenhead .
when completed it will study ice sheets , ocean currents and marine life in the arctic .
other names in the running are pingu and usain bolt , which are proving more popular than traditional contenders like shackleton and endeavour .
the closing date for entries is 16 april 2016 .

documents.title: attacked football fan 's wife criticises case
text: the wife of cambridge united fan simon dobbin has criticised a `` lack of progress '' in the criminal case after her husband was left with brain damage in a post-match attack outside a pub .
mr dobbin , 43 , has just returned home from hospital following the fracas in southend a year ago .
several people have been arrested but no-one has been charged .
his wife nicole said it was `` very frustrating '' that no-one had been `` brought to justice '' .
the crown prosecution service is still considering if charges are to be brought against 13 people .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : wife of attacked cambridge united fan criticises 'lack of progress ' in case peterborugh united break eight match losing run
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this monday morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : traffic lights failure affects a14 at histon
text: there are problems on the a14 westbound near cambridge caused by a traffic light failure at the histon interchange .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : delays on a14 after accident involving a car and a swan
text: there are delays on the a14 westbound near godmanchester following an accident involving a car and a swan .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : generally dry with sunny spells throughout the day
text: today will be fine with cloud at times , but also some sunny spells .
the best of the sunshine will be through the middle part of the day .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
watch my full forecast here , or head to bbc weather for more details for the week ahead .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and thanks for joining us for the start of another week of cambridgeshire live .
as ever , we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for cambridgeshire until 18:00 .
we 've a full weather forecast coming next , and do n't forget , you can get involved with our live page at any time .
send us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
